head.title: Does a Missile Shield Make Sense?

hedline.hl1: Does a Missile Shield Make Sense?

abstract.p: John E Ullmann letter derides newest version of missile defense shield as combination of pork and technical-scientific quackery (S)

block.p: Re ''Clinton and Putin Unable to Agree on Missile Barrier'' (front page, June 5):
Judging by its foreign policy decisions, the Clinton administration and Congress often act as if we had a new cold war with Russia and China.
Re ''Clinton and Putin Unable to Agree on Missile Barrier'' (front page, June 5):
Judging by its foreign policy decisions, the Clinton administration and Congress often act as if we had a new cold war with Russia and China.
Opponents of the original ''Star Wars'' program still have to struggle against the delusions of supporters like the ones who have emerged from their post-Reagan hibernation.

At a 1993 conference that I attended in Moscow about the conversion of military resources, a denizen of the ''secret cities'' of the Russian military suggested that we should both build more and bigger missiles to defend ourselves against asteroids. This got quite a laugh from the audience, but failing that, others there might like a new bottomless bankroll from a ''joint'' anti-missile system. Pork and technical-scientific quackery go well together and know no borders.
JOHN E. ULLMANN Hempstead, N.Y., June 5, 2000
